get.description: Lists all the disks under a subscription.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of disks. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of disks.

managedBy.description: A relative URI containing the ID of the VM that has the disk attached.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk.

sourceUri.description: If createOption is Import, this is the URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk.

storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

diskIOPSReadWrite.description: The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskMBpsReadWrite.description: The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The disks sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, or UltraSSD_LRS.

zones.description: The Logical zone list for Disk.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of snapshots. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of snapshots.

managedBy.description: Unused. Always Null.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk.

sourceUri.description: If createOption is Import, this is the URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk.

storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The snapshots sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, or Standard_ZRS.

get.description: Lists all the disks under a resource group.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of disks. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of disks.

managedBy.description: A relative URI containing the ID of the VM that has the disk attached.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk.

sourceUri.description: If createOption is Import, this is the URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk.

storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

diskIOPSReadWrite.description: The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskMBpsReadWrite.description: The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The disks sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, or UltraSSD_LRS.

zones.description: The Logical zone list for Disk.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the managed disk that is being created. The name can't be changed after the disk is created. Supported characters for the name are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _. The maximum name length is 80 characters.
parameters.name: diskName

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

204.description: If the disk is deleted, this is an expected error code.

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The disks sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, or UltraSSD_LRS.

zones.description: The Logical zone list for Disk.

requestBody.description: Disk object supplied in the body of the Put disk operation.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the managed disk that is being created. The name can't be changed after the disk is created. Supported characters for the name are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _. The maximum name length is 80 characters.
parameters.name: diskName

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

accessSAS.description: A SAS uri for accessing a disk.

schema.description: Data used for requesting a SAS.

durationInSeconds.description: Time duration in seconds until the SAS access expires.

requestBody.description: Access data object supplied in the body of the get disk access operation.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the managed disk that is being created. The name can't be changed after the disk is created. Supported characters for the name are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _. The maximum name length is 80 characters.

parameters.name: api-version

get.description: Lists snapshots under a resource group.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Client Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of snapshots. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of snapshots.

managedBy.description: Unused. Always Null.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk.

sourceUri.description: If createOption is Import, this is the URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk.

storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The snapshots sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, or Standard_ZRS.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

managedBy.description: A relative URI containing the ID of the VM that has the disk attached.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

diskIOPSReadWrite.description: The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskMBpsReadWrite.description: The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10. For a description of the range of values you can set, see [Ultra SSD Managed Disk Offerings](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/disks-ultra-ssd#ultra-ssd-managed-disk-offerings).

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

DiskSku.description: The disks sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, or UltraSSD_LRS.

diskIOPSReadWrite.description: The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes.

diskMBpsReadWrite.description: The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10.

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

GrantAccessData.description: Data used for requesting a SAS.

durationInSeconds.description: Time duration in seconds until the SAS access expires.

ImageDiskReference.description: The source image used for creating the disk.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

KeyVaultAndKeyReference.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of KeK, KeK is optional and when provided is used to unwrap the encryptionKey

keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

KeyVaultAndSecretReference.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the encryption key

secretUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

managedBy.description: Unused. Always Null.

creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

createOption.description: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.

id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference.

lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk.

sourceUri.description: If createOption is Import, this is the URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk.

storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

timeCreated.description: The time when the disk was created.

sku.description: The snapshots sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, or Standard_ZRS.

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of snapshots. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of snapshots.

managedBy.description: Unused. Always Null.

Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

SourceVault.description: The vault id is an Azure Resource Manager Resource id in the form /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/{vaultName}

DiskNameParameter.description: The name of the managed disk that is being created. The name can't be changed after the disk is created. Supported characters for the name are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _. The maximum name length is 80 characters.
DiskNameParameter.name: diskName

ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group.
ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName

SnapshotNameParameter.description: The name of the snapshot that is being created. The name can't be changed after the snapshot is created. Supported characters for the name are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _. The max name length is 80 characters.
SnapshotNameParameter.name: snapshotName

SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
